The problem here is that the extension point associates single content provider for each presentation.  However, task list content providers need to be coupled to an instance of a Task List view.  If there is more than one instance (e.g. two workbench windows) the content provider will break.  Investigating fix now...

Fyi, when we make this API for 3.0 I would like to remove the coupling to TaskListView and only couple to the viewer, added note to: http://wiki.eclipse.org/Mylyn_Porting_Guide#Pending_Changes_for_Mylyn_3.0

Rob: in the future please review patches of this sort more carefully.  Thankfully this was caught by our multi-window unit tests, but we could have put out a build with a broken API and a regression for those who use multiple workbench Windows, which is a non-trivial number of users.  Also, ensure that changes of this magnitude include unit test coverage before applying.

Eugene: for changes of this magnitude, please first propose any API or extension point that you're planning on adding and provide additional test coverage of the key changes.  The general direction was good and it's great that you added docs, but this kind of change usually requires some design discussion to avoid inadvertently introducing this kind of problem.
